candidate Profile Description.summary: Feliks Royzen is a dedicated researcher with expertise in neuroscience and data analysis. He has a proven track record in neural decoding, statistical analysis, and the development of visualization tools. With a strong background in Python, MATLAB, and AWS, he is committed to advancing the field of neuroscience through innovative research and technology.

projects.name: Neural decoding of visually presented stimuli
projects.description: Creation and management of full-stack (AWS) visualization and statistical analysis tool for EEG and other time-frequency domain recordings.

projects.name: Pre-clinical investigation of genetic therapy for ataxia
projects.description: Showed reduction in electrophysiological biomarkers of neurodegeneration with IONIS genetic therapy in mouse models.

experience.title: Graduate Research Assistant
experience.company: Neuronal Dynamics Lab - Biomedical Engineering Department, University of Utah

projects.name: Investigation of mechanisms underlying hippocampal theta oscillations
projects.description: Discovered novel mechanism for theta oscillations using ex vivo whole hippocampus.

cloud_technologies: AWS (S3, EC2/ELB, RDS, Cloudfront, WAF, ACM, Route 53)

publications.title: Balanced synaptic currents underlie low-frequency oscillations in the subiculum
